brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to evaluate the impact of pharmacogenomic aspects of drug
      metabolism on the measurement of drug and drug metabolites on urine drug testing (UDT).

clinical_study.brief_title: Urine Toxicology With Pharmacogenomic Interpretation Assay: UTOPIA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Able to provide written informed consent

          -  Pharmacogenomic testing within the last 60 days

          -  Planned UDT

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subject has chronic renal dysfunction, Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 4 or 5

          -  Subject has a history of abnormal hepatic function within the last 2 years (INR >1.2
             not attributable to anticoagulant medications, AST or ALT >1.5x normal, or suspected
             cirrhosis)

          -  Subject has a history of malabsorption (short gut syndrome);

          -  Subject has a history of any gastric or small bowel surgery;

          -  Subject is currently hospitalized;

          -  Subject is currently receiving intravenous medication.

study_pop.textblock: Male and female subjects who are considered candidates for UDT.

clinical_study.official_title: Urine Toxicology With Pharmacogenomic Interpretation Assay: UTOPIA

primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of genetically-determined abnormal metabolism of drugs tested with UDT, classified as genetic effects on metabolism (GEM) + for rapid metabolizers, GEM 0 for normal metabolizers, and GEM - for slow metabolizers.
primary_outcome.measure: Influence of CYP450 drug metabolism on quantitative UDT

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of illicit drugs detected on UDT and the GEM classification associated with these medications
Non-prescribed drugs detected on UDT and the GEM classification associated with these medications
False positive immunoassay results, defined as positive immunoassay concurrent with negative quantitative testing
Frequency of target drug regimen changes by the treating physician due to pharmacogenomic test results
Frequency of illicit drug changes by the subject due to UDT results, as observed at the time of repeat UDT
Frequency of non-prescribed drug changes by the subject due to UDT results, as detected at the time of repeat UDT
